reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: NON-PROLIFERATION [Covers household items, including ranges, refrigerators, washers, dryers, ironers, freezers, window-type air-conditioners for residential properties, transformers and voltage regulators for appliances, as well as living room, dining room, and bedroom suites; rugs, draperies, lamps; and fabric for furniture reupholstering. Special Purpose Equipment [Covers the costs of special purpose equipment.]. [Covers the cost of supply items not otherwise classified. Includes petty cash purchases as distinguished from specific purpose vouchers.]. NON-PROLIFERATION [Covers the costs of computer and printer supplies, other IT supplies, and off-the-shelf software purchases of $25,000 or less or with a useful life of 2 years or less.]. NON-PROLIFERATION [Covers the purchases of IT equipment including central processing units (CPUs) and related systems equipment, and costs of initial installation of equipment when performed under contract.]. NON-PROLIFERATION [Covers the costs of direct payments to USPS, DHL, and other courier services.]. [Covers miscellaneous contractual services not otherwise classified.] [Covers miscellaneous contractual services not otherwise classified.]. NON-PROLIFERATION [This includes bookbinding, rebinding of existing books, and other printing and reproduction work not otherwise classified.]. NON-PROLIFERATION [Covers the cost of supply items not otherwise classified. Includes petty cash purchases as distinguished from specific purpose vouchers.]. [Covers the costs of direct payments to USPS, DHL, and other courier services.] [Covers the costs of direct payments to USPS, DHL, and other courier services.]. [Covers the costs of computer and printer supplies, other IT supplies, and off-the-shelf software purchases of $25,000 or less or with a useful life of 2 years or less.]. NON-PROLIFERATION [Covers miscellaneous contractual services not otherwise classified.]. [This includes bookbinding, rebinding of existing books, and other printing and reproduction work not otherwise classified.]. [Covers household items, including ranges, refrigerators, washers, dryers, ironers, freezers, window-type air-conditioners for residential properties, transformers and voltage regulators for appliances, as well as living room, dining room, and bedroom suites; rugs, draperies, lamps; and fabric for furniture reupholstering. Special Purpose Equipment [Covers the costs of special purpose equipment.]. [Covers the purchases of IT equipment including central processing units (CPUs) and related systems equipment, and costs of initial installation of equipment when performed under contract.]
